|ram1_num = |nvramsize = |eth_cpu = true |eth2chip = Atheros;AR8035-A; |lan_ports = 1 |lan_speed = 1GbE |ethstandard = |auto_mdix = |sup_jumbo = |ethoui = |oui = |bootwait = |stockbootloader = U-boot;4.1.0.0;Ralink; |stockos = Linux;2.6.36;; |exp_if_types = |exp_sim_num = |exp_pcmcia_num = |exp_expcard_num = |exp_minipci_num = |exp_minipcie_num = |exp_usb_num = |exp_cf_num = |exp_sdmmc_num = |exp_ide_num = |exp_ata_num = |exp_sata_num = |exp_esata_num = |exp_parallel = |exp_sfp_num = |exp_M.2 = |exp_hdmi_num = |usb_hub = |pwr_volt_type = VAC |pwr_vac = 100-240 |pwr_ac_hz = 50/60 |pwr_amp_ac = 0.3 |pwr_conn = AC (direct) |serial = yes,, 4-pin header,, |jtag = |specialfeat = |flags = |addchip = |802dot11_protocols = abgn+ac |defaulip = 192.168.0.1 |defaultlogin = admin |defaultpass = admin |defaultssid = TP-LINK_Extender_2.4GHz,TP-LINK_Extender_5GHz, |defaultssid_regex = |default_ch = |is_manuf = Yes |tpfirmware = OpenWrt |availability = Discontinued |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 08/24/2015 |estreldate = |estprice = |upc = |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = B00TQD2BYK |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = China |buttons = |led = |dimensions = |weight = |wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1cpu = true |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = U.FL |rad1txchains = 2 |rad1rxchains = 2 |rad1sstreams = 2 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad1n = 300 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 |wi2_if_name = |rad2chip1 = MediaTek;MT7610EN; |rad2oui = |rad2_ant_conn = U.FL |rad2txchains = 1 |rad2rxchains = 1 |rad2sstreams = 1 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11a/n/ac |acqam2 = |rad2ac = 433 |rad2n = 150 |rad2a = 54 |rad2freq = 5 }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== "2053500117" is silkscreened on the board in the [https://fccid.io/document.php?id=2721872 FCC photos]. :Hardware appears to be very similar to the [[Netgear EX6100]]. Unit has internal power supply and plugs directly into mains power socket. Stock firmware only functions as an extender and client bridge and does :not support access point mode. ===Basic details=== To get the unit open, remove the two screws at the top. Squeeze the case in the middle :of each side t help loosen the two clips that continue to hold it together. It takes some force to separate the two halves, but be careful not to damage the short :the antenna cables when the case finally gives. There is a ceramic heatsink on the CPU - you can remove this to inspect it by giving :it a twist. It will remain adhesive so can be re-attached when finished. ==Links of Interest== ===Reviews=== *[http://geeklingo.net/tp-link-ac-750-wi-fi-range-extender-re210-reviewed/ ''TP-Link AC750 Wi-Fi Range Extender (RE210)'' on '''geeklingo'''] *[http://help-wifi.com/tp-link/obzor-tp-link-ac750-re210-dvuxdiapazonnyj-usilitel-wi-fi-seti/ ''TP-Link AC750 RE210 review'' on '''help-wifi'''] (RU) ==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} ===Flashing OpenWrt=== {{OpenWrt |techdata = https://openwrt.org/toh/hwdata/tp-link/tp-link_re210_v1 |wikipage = |forumpage = |forumpage2 = |forumpage3 = |github = |target = ramips |subtarget = mt7620 |arch = mipsel_24kc |support_started_version = 21.02.0 |current_supported_version = |image_too_big = |unsupportedfuncntions = |comment = }} Please insert instructions here ==JTAG-Serial Info== ===Serial=== ====Serial Pinouts==== *J1 is a serial header. Pin 1 is closest to the top :of the unit and pin 4 closest to the Ethernet port. The pinout is as follows: 
© 1 - Tx
© 2 - Rx
© 3 - Gnd
® 4 - Vcc
Connect with settings 57600 8N1. Signalling voltage is 3.3v. {{/Serial info}} ==Pictures==
